label: BOB YOUNG, '22 GRADUATE OF MARYLAND, IS A HERO

resource.chars:
BOB YOUNG, '22 GRADUATE
OF MARYLAND, IS A HERO

Lieut. Robert H. Young, of the
Gsth Infantry, U. S. A., better
known about College Park as just
plain Bob, lias again showed the
stuff that earned him honors while
a student at Maryland. Bob, who
was graduated in the class of ’22
and who now is stationed in Porto
Rica, recently was commended for
“heroic conduct” in saving three
persons from drowning.
A motor truck with three oc-
cupants had gone into about six
feet of water in San Juan Bay when
Lieut. Young happened to pass by.
Although in uniform and wearing
heavy riding boots, he plunged into
the water and rescued a 12-year old
boy, unable to swim. He then
jumped back into the water and
saved a boy 3-years old. Still again
he returned to the water and as-
sisted in the releasing the third
person who had been caught in the
cage of the truck.
While at Maryland, among other
.lungs, Hob was president of the
Students’ Assembly and Cadet-
Major of thr ' o. T. C., then rank-
ing student officer of the military
unit.
His brother Walter, a member of
the Varsity foot ball team, also was
graduated from Maryland in the
class of ’24.
Their parents, Mr. and Mrs.
Robert H. Young, reside in Wash-
ington.
U. of M. 
Dean S. Lesher, ’23, visited the
campus several days before return-
ing to Harvard Law School from
which he will graduate next spring.
